subject: Re: [junit] Junit Reports
msgSnippet: ... Does a debug/verbose log tell you anything else useful? Maybe there s a problem with the fact that the filename you want to write to has a space in it. --
messageBody:
claudioillanes wrote:

>
>
> I am trying to get a report with format="noframes" to write out to
> specific directory and am not able to. I am using Ant 1.5.1 and here
> is the code I have specified:
>
> <tstamp><format property="build.time" pattern="yyyy-MM-
> dd.HH.mm"/></tstamp>
>
>
> <junitreport todir="${test.unit.reports.dir}/${build.time}">
> <fileset dir="${test.data.dir}">
> <include name="TEST-*.xml"/>
> </fileset>
> <report format="noframes" todir="${test.unit.reports.dir}/
> ${build.time}"/>
> </junitreport>
> <fail message="One or more JUnit Tests failed! Check log and/or
> reports." if="test.failed"/>
>
>
>
> BUT this does not even seem to work??? What am I doing wrong? The
> error I keep getting is the following:
>
>
> file:C:/VICMAE4/build.xml:527: Unable to write test aggregate
> to 'C:\VICMAE4\test\reports\unit\2004
> 06-04.11.56\TESTS-TestSuites.xml'

Does a debug/verbose log tell you anything else useful? Maybe there's a
problem with the fact that the filename you want to write to has a space
in it.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
